direction.raw_text: And they've only chose to live the life style, they don't believe they're -- (hears something) What's that? Ripley strains to listen.  In the distance: KNOCKING.  Someone is knocking on the walls. A VOICE calls out -- INT. PRISON LEVEL CORRIDOR - NIGHT JOHN (hoarse) Ripley! He moves down the hallway. BANGS his fist against the walls every few feet -- Waits a moment for a reply, then moves on. INT. ANTHONY'S CELL Anthony gets off the floor - Moves so she can see into his cell: The walls of Anthony's cell are covered with charcoal sketches - Different versions of demons and the devil.  She rolls her eyes - This guy is an Android! Anthony crosses to his cell door, peers through eye level. INT. PRISON LEVEL CORRIDOR HALLWAY - ANTHONY POV John coming towards him, knocking on the doors of boarded up cells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey -- you knocking -- cut it out -- You're going to wake everybody up. John moves to Anthony's door.  Looks at him through the slot. Anthony recognizes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brother John? John unbolts Anthony's door. Picks him up by his cassock -- JOHN Anthony?  Thought you dead fifteen years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Made too good for that.  What're you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking -- the Abbot -- ANTHONY What?  You look like you've seen the devil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has. Anthony turns to look back at Ripley -- moves aside so John can see her face at the hole -- ANTHONY You mean he -- Anthony turns back - John is gone. INT. THE CORRIDOR As John begins to PULL the outermosk planks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was right, wasn't I?  You've seen it, you've seen the Alien? John pauses at that. His eyes tighten at the memory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can tell you have.  I was right. It came with me. (to the wall, sharp) Go away. John stops.  Looks at the wall. Ripley's voice comes clearly through the wood...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, priest, or whatever you are, I know what you want.  I can't help you. I couldn't help any of the others. Just stop what you're doing.  Go away. Do you understand? John has opened a crack that exposes Ripley's eyes. He stares at her a beat, tries to think of what to reply -- He goes back to work as she continues her confession...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You going to stay, Father?  But you're not going to talk.  Okay.  Then you can listen.  You should listen.  Your Abbot was right.  I am guilty.  But not of heresy.  Of murder. John stops again. Just stares at her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The murder of the crew of the Nostromo. That was when I first met the Alien. That reminds him of why he's here. He doubles his efforts at the boards...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not the same one that's here now. Or maybe it is.  Maybe they're all the same one.  I couldn't save my crew then. I should have been able to.  But I couldn't. When I went the second time -- Her eyes soften.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I met Newt.  Newt.  I fought -- stayed alive to keep Newt alive. Hoped maybe that would make up for... She trails off.  Slides down the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now he got her too.  What's the point? (hard again) Just go away.  Leave me in here.  If you let me out you'll want me to help you and it will start all over again. Let it end. John breaks through, flickering torch light streams in the mote filled air around him.  Ripley looks up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't help you. John, heaving and panting from the excertion. Swallows...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Puh. (pant) Please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It never ends. INT. CORRIDOR - PRISON LEVEL - NIGHT A long, twisted-plank-floored corridor with a torch every twenty feet.  There is MOVEMENT at the far end.  Something is coming towards us - FLICKERING in and out of the light and shadow -- RIPLEY O/S Sheep? RIPLEY, JOHN AND ANTHONY Running together.  Anthony carries a long wooden staff like a spear.  John has his bag.  Ripley a torch. We move with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It must be able to take on some of the characteristics of the animal it grows in. Maybe they are from some sort of aggressive soldier race -- warring parties drop the eggs on opposing planets -- RIPLEY And the alien takes on the form of the creature that finds it, assuming that animal is the dominant life form on the planet.  So when it gestates in a man -- Ripley shudders at the memory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a biped.  In a sheep or cow, a quadroped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit.  I just didn't think it could do that to animals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute - I thought you were the expert on this monster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that the only reason you came to get me out?  Because I knew about this thing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  I mean no.  I mean, that was part of it.  Look.  I never thought you were wrong. I was wrong not to say anything.  I was afraid to speak up.  It's hard to be a monk, you know? Ripley stops.  Looks at him. A long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.  If anything, you're honest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We all are.  Took vows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know about the Abbot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure he thinks what he did was right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that speaking up for someone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Charity. She smiles.  They turn a corner... INT. SLOPING CORRIDOR - NIGHT This hallway slopes downwards a few degrees.  The three find themselves trotting, leaning backward to keep their balance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, let's forget about the past and get on to our survival.  No more prisoners behind us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not for years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay -- If the Alien's had a few days to lay his eggs our only hope is to get off this - What is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arceon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Satellite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get to my ship and get off this Satellite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave Arceon.  Can't leave the library -- RIPLEY A Tape Library?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Books.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The reason we are out here.  Like the Monks who guarded Monastery Libraries on remote islands off England during the First Plague -- RIPLEY There must be books on other colonies -- JOHN Some of these books survived the burning of the Libraries of Alexandria.  They contain knowledge that exists in no other record.  Their value is unestimable. He runs his hand along the spine of the book in his bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're supposed to protect them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what does an android have to do with all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a spy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Company planted me here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Company?  What does the Company have to do with this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They built this prison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prison?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Colony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prison.  They are all political heretics. Ripley looks at John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You left that part out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The order was more of a counter culture, a reaction to the Technology that was beginning to take over everyone's lives. It was a simple enough idea - Read, don't watch disk.  Walk, don't pump more carbons into the air.  The earliest members renounced technology.  Started to collect the remaining books.  Nobody would have noticed if it hadn't been for the Virus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your Abbot talked about that.  The New Plague.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A computer virus.  A bad program.  By this time the Corporate structure was transglobal, all the world's data storage systems were linked.  It spread through two countries before it was stopped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After a scare like that, thousands flocked to our retreat.  People started clamoring for written information.  For our books. They abandoned the modern ways -- RIPLEY I think I can see how this comes out. They gave up their possessions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This was a threat -- RIPLEY To the Company.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They sold the technology.  A movement to live simply was quickly twisted by Federal agents into a political movement against the Company-controlled World Government.  Too much was at stake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too much profit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were sentenced as political dissidents. This orbiter is our gulag.  All the men were packed up with all our books, and towed into space.  Ten thousand men.  The eldest died very quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Company had such a sense of irony. Sending you out on this wooden tub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was placed among them as a sensor. Keeps tabs on the movement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So how'd they find out about you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told them.  After the supply ship's stopped coming I saw no point in keeping up the charade.  Since I was a sort of walking reminder of technology, they cast me down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Join the club. (to John) I figured this wasn't planned.  You don't have to be a genius to see it wouldn't be prudent to try to preserve man's written works for generations -- without women. John looks embarrassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I don't know about your New Plague, but I was just on Earth and everything's fine. John has a doubtful look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was right about the Alien, wasn't I? Means I must be right about the Earth. The logic behind her argument is uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's better than nothing.  Come on. They reach the end of the corridor. It opens into -- INT. TRANSOM SPACE - PRISON LEVEL An enormous open space between "cell blocks." The Wall behind them is honey-combed with corridor openings going up four stories, connected by aged, warped wooden ladders reminiscent of Indian cave dwellings.  Only wooden. The room stretches several football field lengths ahead of them -- falling off into gloom. They stand silent for a moment, dwarfed by the size of the room and the task ahead of them.  Finally -- RIPLEY At any rate, let's forget about the Earth completely - whether you're right or I'm right what's important is getting the hell out of here.  From here my ship is...? John points up at the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Heaven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.  And this is... Anthony and John nod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This orbiter was patterned after a medieval concept of the universe -- (makes a circle in the air) They call the top half "Heaven - " JOHN The Abbey, the fields -- ANTHONY The bottom half is "Hell."  Where we are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aptly named.  What's in the middle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Work with me here.  How far is it back to the surface of the planet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As a stone falls --- Five miles through the center.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the elevator -- the thing they lowered me down in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ropes cut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's smart.  First he cuts their escape off, then works his way down through the monastery level by level until there isn't a thing left alive.  Interesting...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you start appreciating him more than me and I'll find a way to shut you down, capisce, Andy?  How do we get up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are ladders. She stops.  John and Anthony continue on a few steps and then stop and walk back to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five miles with the Alien between us and there?  Good luck, boys. She turns and heads back towards her cell -- John catches her shoulder -- JOHN You can't -- RIPLEY Can't what?  Not help you go to your deaths?  I've had my fill of that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need you.  I can't do it alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've fought these creatures twice before.  It take a lot to kill these things.  Heavy artillery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't have weapons here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about something we can make weapons from?  Do you have anything like that -- any modern things here? John SHAKES his head vehemently -- JOHN We renounced technology.  It was those things that caused the Plague.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a man-made planet.  Something has to be recirculating your air, your water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.  I just took it for granted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Most people do.  Without some sort of technology we haven't got a chance. From behind them:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is technology. John and Ripley turn to look at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A room.  A Technology room.  Fresh air and water come out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An atmosphere processing plant -- ANTHONY The heart and lungs of Arceon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One level beneath the underground sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's five levels up -- ANTHONY (points into the gloom) On the other side of the orbiter. John looks at Ripley -- JOHN A chance. Ripley looks from John's earnest face to the darkness and back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right.  You've got me - so far. But here's the deal:  I don't know how many of your brethren are going to be alive when we get up there, but if we make it to my ship, you're all coming with me.  We'll take as many of your precious books as we can carry, but we're going.  I'm not going to fight this thing again to end up alone again.  Understand? John nods his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're all dead anyway.  We might as well go fi -- She feels a TWINGE in her midsection -- Doubles over.  Anthony and John each take an arm -- RIPLEY Ugh - I'm all right. She takes a deep breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still thawing out.  I hate hyper sleep... Come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. ARCEON - MONASTERY LEVEL - NIGHT The formerly idyllic landscape has been reduced to a scorched battlefield.  Wooden huts leveled.  Small fires dot the land. The air thick with ash and greasy smoke. DOZENS OF MONKS swarm across the countryside like ants on a mound of spilt sugar.  In one hand a taper or torch held high, in the other hand their WEAPON: scythe, pitchfork, hoe, whatever they could get ahold of, seem pitifully out of place. Some pound sharpened stakes into the ground, others push carts into rough barricades. A "Platoon" of Monks huddle around trap doors open on the wooden "ground."  More ladders. They climb down to -- AN UNDERGROUND WHEAT FIELD - NIGHT Just beneath the Monastery level of the satellite: an Underground Wheatfield.  Tall golden grass stretches out for miles, swaying gently around huge wooden columns that support the Abbey fifty feet above -- THE CEILING A lattice-work of suspended troughs and wooden pipes -- the "plumbing," the understructure, of the Monastery. THE MONKS Descend the ladders single file.  Fear is in all of their faces though most have only heard the stories.  They move cautiously into the wheat.  Spread out through the field in the jaggedly drawn skirmish line. THE ABBOT The Bald Tribunal Monk's dried blood splattered on his cassock, stands atop an empty wooden wagon.  From this vantage point he watches THE MONKS IN THE FIELD THRASH and POKE their way forward leaving trails through the high grass.  Their attempt at an orderly progression quickly falls apart as they get strung out all over the field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay together.  Together... Then another movement catches the Abbot's eye -- AHEAD of the Monks - the wheat waves against the wind. Begins to ripple -- the wheat flattens. a TRAIL forms. SomeTHING is MOVING in the long grass. Moving towards the Lead Monk -- FAST. The Abbot opens his mouth as if to shout a warning - even though the Monk closest to the moving trail is too far away to hear him - before he can make a sound The Alien closes the gap - Feeling horribly helpless he can only watch as AARGH-Aa -! The Lead Monk gives one strangled CRY before he disappears beneath the surface of the long grass.  His taper falls among the long, dry stalks -- begins to SMOKE... The Abbot can see the trail moving towards his men before they can.  He finds his voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run!  RUN! The Monks in the field turn from the spot where the Monk screamed towards the Abbot -- TURN THEIR BACKS to the now moving again trail -- ABBOT No - NO.  The -- The Alien hits the skirmish line at a flanking angle -- RAKING through five Monks like a scythe through wheat. His tail, arms WHIP out -- SNAP their spines like kindling. Lost torches ignite the wheat... The field BURSTS INTO FLAME. Smoke fills the air. In the smoky commotion the Monks break rank and start running. Weapons in front of them -- SWINGING wildly -- Screaming.  Crying.  DYING. One Frightened Monk runs through another with his pitchfork. Another hears something crashing through the grass towards him and buries his scythe in his best friend's chest. And through it all the Alien seems to be everywhere. Using the chalky smoke for cover as it SLASHES and TEARS its way across the field -- THE ABBOT Frozen in terror to the spot.   Squints through the smoke to see what has happened to his flock.  Hears the WAILS of defeat rising up from the wounded. The waving grass is flattened as The Alien moves towards him -- He can finally pry himself from his perch on the wagon. He climbs down.  As his feet hit the wooden floor he feels a shadow fall over him.  The little hairs on the back of his neck stand up.  He slowly turns... THE ALIEN Rises out of the grass in front of the Holy Man. Slowly rises up to its height of almost three meters. It's long, smooth head is no longer black and slimy. It is golden. It's cable-like arms are sheathed in a straw-like covering. It has adapted to the environment of the wheat field.  Its now grass-like lips draw back into a ghastly parody of a smile. The Abbot SCREAMS and RUNS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It isn't your fault, you know. INT. TRANSOM SPACE - SERIES OF SHOTS They move across the huge room...Anthony a few paces ahead. Their candles throwing only enough light to see several yards. Wind whistles through the huge room, timbers creaking like some gigantic old house settling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those things you said before -- Ripley remembers her "confession."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I read about it in psychology books. Sometimes when people outlive someone they cared for, they transfer some of the guilt for that person's death to themselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a belly full of that from the Psychtechs when I was on Earth.  Yeah. "Survivor Guilt syndrome," or something like that.  But that's not what I was thinking about.  I was thinking about my "friend" up there. She looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was on the pod.  He killed Newt but not me.  Why not me?  It's almost like he's playing with me.  Maybe they have some sort of race memory.  Maybe he knows what I did to his "mother." That's why he didn't just kill me. That would be too easy.  He has to torment me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You make it sound human.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, I don't know what it is. John unconsiously fingers his book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I do. INT. LADDER-WELL - PRISON LEVEL - NIGHT At the end of the space a rough hewn wooden ladder leads to another block of cell corridors four stories up. Years of damp air have warped the ladder. Ripley leads the way, torch in her left hand. They climb... INT. END OF PRISON CORRIDOR - FOURTH LEVEL - NIGHT Dark.  Ripley is the first one up. She raises her torch and heads down the new corridor alone. The cells here have no doors. She holds her torch in one -- An old skeleton sits in quiet contemplation. AT THE LADDER John is just climbing off, Anthony right behind him. Anthony is winded.  He reaches up for a helping hand. John looks back and sees that Ripley has moved ahead without them, then reaches down to help Anthony. Their hands clasp -- ANTHONY HAS A "VISION" He is seemingly standing in an open field, sheep grazing peacefully at his side. SUDDENLY he is ATTACKED by a horde of Medieval demons. Fish faced demons.  Man-headed bird demons. They fly about him, grab hold of his limbs. The Sheep nearest him opens it's mouth to reveal a horde of razor sharp fangs, SINKS THEM INTO HIS ANKLE -- Anthony SCREAMS -! RIPLEY Down the corridor HEARS the scream, turns back -- sees Anthony fighting with himself, struggling against John's grasp - ANTHONY Balanced precariously on the top of the ladder in the real world as he fights against the demons in his android mind -- He JERKS -- Pulls his left ankle out of the grasp of the DEMON SHEEP -- OFF the ladder - forty foot drop waiting below him... JOHN Struggles to keep his death grip on Anthony's hand. It's all that keeps Anthony from falling back down the shaft -- JOHN Jesus Christ.  Ripleeeee -! He PULLS with all his might... ANTHONY SEES a horrible BIRD-DEMON grasping his hand in its beak -- BITING through his wrist.  He waves his staff in the air -- He aims for its head: CRACK -! WHACKS John's hand with his staff -- John HOWLS in pain - LETS GO -- Anthony TEETERS BACK ON ONE FOOT, arms waving in the air -- Ripley's hands SHOOT OUT -- GRAB Anthony's cassock -- STOP his fall. Anthony's eyes open wide at the sight of this new horror -- A terrible, wet, black cable-armed CREATURE that's latched itself onto his cassock -- Long, shiny head. Ripley has become the Alien. WHACK! Anthony HITS the Creature with his staff -- HITS Ripley on the head. WHACK! Again.  In the face. John tries to take hold of Anthony's staff arm -- WHACK! The cane WHIPS against the side of his head, knocking him back. Ripley sets her feet and pulls on Anthony's cassock -- Opens her mouth - GRUNTS -- ANTHONY sees the terrible Alien open it's maw to devour him. WHACK! His staff connects with the bridge of Ripley's nose. She sees flashes of light -- loses her balance -- Pitches forward, starts to go over with Anthony -- JOHN GRABS THEM! Wraps his arms around the struggling pair and like a sumo wrestler LIFTS and FALLS backwards - carrying the three of them into the corridor -- WHUMPH! They land on the floor in a heap. Anthony continues to FLAIL ABOUT -- Ripley and John pin him to the floor between them. Finally, the vision leaves him. He loses consciousness. JOHN Breathing heavy - opens his eyes -- He's staring right into Ripley's face. Less than an inch away. He's laying on top of her. She's breathing heavy too. A long, uncomfortable moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're welcome. They roll off each other. Her hand goes up to her nose. Blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm all right. John reaches into his bag, withdraws a small cotton bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold this against your nose.  It'll stop the flow. She looks over at him questioningly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a doctor. She holds the small bag against her nose.  The bleeding stops. They move over to Anthony - try to help him to his feet. He shakes them off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No - please.  Just let me sit. Awhile. He rubs his temples.  White, milk-like sweat runs down his cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The reason I'm down here. John points to his own eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Visions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dreams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Androids can't dream...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's probably what they thought when they built me.  But my brain is cyber- organic - patterned after the human brain - it functions the same way a human brain does.  It accumulates random images and sensations during waking hours, but unlike the human brain that sloughs them off during sleep -- RIPLEY Androids don't sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.  Maybe they've fixed this on later models, but I don't.  Do you know what happens to the human brain when it is deprived of sleep?  It starts to run off the dreams while you're awake, as hallucinations.  Same thing with me. For twenty years I absorbed data on this planetoid.  A little after we lost contact with Earth the visions started.  They thought I was insane.  I had to explain that it was because I was an android. They liked that even less.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I always see.  Images of Monsters. Demons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're portents.  They stand for an evil yet to come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just images I've absorbed from those old books and have no way to get rid of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw the inside of your cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My head is full of them.  I try to get them out any way I can. His eyelids droop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that.  I'll settle for rest. He closes his eyes.  Ripley recovers the torch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay with him. Ripley tried to stand - John takes her arm, pulls her down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  We all need rest.  You especially. Ripley considers him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doctor's orders. She smiles and sits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Besides, you see what happens when you get ahead of us.  We should stay together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right.  He's still above us, anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've faced this evil twice before - I guess I've gotten sensitive to it -- (beat) You're really a Doctor? John pats his canvas bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See my bag?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that book?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't buy "just a book" from a guy who says we can't leave the planet without the library.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just... a medical book I might need.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have any food in there, do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only if you can eat bandages. Ripley rubs her midsection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a few hours that's going to sound good.  Going in and out of suspended animation - Christ I probably haven't eaten in a year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should've eaten the bread.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rest! Ripley lets her head loll back against the wall. Closes her eyes.  Time passes. Her brow knits. John sees this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You weren't hurt when I landed on you? Bruised a rib? He reaches over and puts his hands beneath her cassock. Feels her midsection.  His hands are warm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure you're a doctor? He withdraws his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sort of.  My father passed on when we first came here.  The Abbey's Physician - Father Anselm - took me in.  He really raised me -- (pause) Taught me what he could before he passed away.  He was schooled on Earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm just hungry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You haven't eaten since I took you out of your tube.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did that... She reaches out and takes hold of his hands.  Turns them over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You burned yourself on the escape pod. Her hands on his makes him feel...uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, I guess. They look into each other's eyes -- ANTHONY O/S You should've eaten the bread. Ripley, embarrassed, releases his hands. Looks at Anthony.  He's trying to stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough rest.  There's beasties afoot. They start into... A NARROW CORRIDOR Ceiling so low their torches must be held out in front of them. Ripley makes an effort not to move faster than the two monks. INT. LADDER SHAFT A great long ladder hanging in the middle of nowhere. Seems at least a mile long. The group climbs... A SERPENTINE CORRIDOR Liquid drips through the ceiling planks over head. Falls into RED puddles on the slanted floor. John kneels, dips his fingertips -- JOHN Blood. (sniffs) Mixed with sea water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're getting close to the center of the arc -- near the sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Getting close... John HEARS somthing. Raises his hand -- "stop" The group stops.  Flatten themselves against the wall. John takes Anthony's staff. Moves forward with it held out in front of him... WHIRLS around a blind corner -- SHOVES something against the wall -- Thump! It struggles -- Ripley and Anthony run up -- raise their tapers -- Revealing:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Abbot. Cassock torn, dirty.  Hair, eyes wild. Anthony's staff across his throat. John pulls back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father -- RIPLEY (sarcastic) What are you doing down here, father? You look like you've seen something that doesn't exist. The Abbot runs his fingers through his hair.  Smoothes it down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was their spiritual leader.  I was not prepared to lead them in battle. Not against that thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one could be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you said the evil was inside me -- that sealing me up was the answer to all your problems?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Destruction.  The destruction YOU brought to us!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I only tried to warn you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing with this woman --?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are going to the Technology Room. Trying to find some way to fight -- ABBOT You don't join the devil to fight the devil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's helping us -- ABBOT Look who defends the deceiver -- the one who isn't even human.  John, can't you see what is happening?  On ancient Earth, during the Black Death - many believed that God had abandoned them, so they appealed to the Devil.  Flocked to him hoping to save their bodies - losing their souls in the bargain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father, we're all on the run from the same monster so let's not resort to the fire and brimstone routine.  I've been enlightened about your "movement." Pretty funny to be tried for heresy on a planet of heretics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. The time for pretense is past.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right.  I was trying to keep you quiet. JOHN Sir --?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do what I have to do to keep the Brotherhood together.  We all gave up believing in Earth a long time ago.  How do you think they would feel if told their exiled was in vain?  That the holocaust they were trying to avoid never occured?  Those men up there have grown to live with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And with you as their leader. The Abbot smiles.  Ripley is sharp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You threatened the status quo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you, protector of knowledge and truth, lied to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only about you.  The rest I still believe.  If Earth still orbits its sun there is no way it could have survived being reduced to Barbarism.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're as bad as the Company.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ripley -- RIPLEY That's why you ran.  After all your talk death stared you in the face and you were afraid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not afraid of death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Alien.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Organism.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Devil. INT. TECHNOLOGY ROOM CORRIDOR The now four refugees work their way into the final corridor. Dark.  Turns at sharp angles.  Blind alleys. The floor is uneven, wood aged and twisted. Warped by years of water dripping from above. The group strings out as it moves into the darkness, candles held high... ANTHONY Bringing up the rear, puts his walking stick down -- SNAPP!!! Everybody stops at the sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that? Anthony pulls his stick from the grasp of a--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man trap. They lower their candles.  Look to: THE FLOOR Interspersed throughout the timbers -- Spring jawed, steel toothed, BEAR TRAPS. Rusted.  Open.  And all around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In case anyone tried to get in and tamper with the technology. The four of them are standing in the middle of a mine-field of man traps.  Nobody moves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't move.  Don't breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't just stand here and wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Floor's too unstable to try to walk around them. John pulls a loose board from the corridor wall. Turns and kneels at the trap in front of him. Pokes the end of the board into the jaws... SNAP!! The others jump at the sound -- ABBOT John - what are you doing? John pulls the stick out of the rusted jaws. Moves to the next trap -- Snap!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's thinking like a leader.  Everyone: Grab wood.  Spring the traps.  Clear a path. (proud of him) Good work, Father John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brother.  Let's go. Ripley pulls a plank from the wall next to her. Exposes a bit of the surface underneath -- It's METAL. She touches the cool, familiar material.  Smiles. Now she knows this is not a dream. She turns and SPRINGS the trap in front of her -- SNAP!! THE FOUR Slowly make their way down the corridor, one hand holding a candle high, the other poking a piece of wood into the trap in front of them... SNAP-SNAP...SNAP. SNAP. walking carefully around the yet unfired traps.... THE DOOR TO THE TECHNOLOGY ROOM A huge wooden door with no knob or handle.  Looks like it could almost be part of the wall.  John and Ripley are the first to it.  They put down their planks and begin to feel around the edges of the door for some purchase. The Abbot joins them. BACK IN THE CORRIDOR Anthony lags behind.  He senses a presence in the hallway. Hears a sound behind him. We see a GLIMPSE of something -- He turns towards the sound -- Empty hallway. He thinks.  Starts forward again -- with his ear cocked to the rear... SNAP! AT THE DOOR Ripley, John and The Abbot knock on the door, walls. Ripley leans her head against the wall in frustration and exhaustion.  To get this far, and be locked out. She feels sick to her stomach. How long since she had food? She looks over at John. He is staring at her. He turns red at being caught.  Cute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just - are you allright?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tied.  Without sleep, food -- I just feel my age. (smiles) Figuring hyperspace time, I'm almost a hundred. She wipes her brow and goes back to knocking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? The wall beneath his fist sounds hollow. Fingernails find the edge of the plank and pull -- The plank slides aside on tiny, rusty pneumatic pistons. BEHIND THE PLANK A primitive KEYBOARD.  Circa late twentieth century.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think this is it. Ripley and the Abbot move over to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Technology.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah - a hundred years ago.  An antique.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead and what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open the door, woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get to it, but listen to me -- you may dress like you're living in the middle ages but you can't treat me like your chambermaid, or whatever Monks had. UP THE HALL - ANTHONY Hears the sound again.  Turns. Nothing again. He pauses... Turns back quickly -- The wooden wall MOVES - steps forward -- THE ALIEN Adapted itself to look like WOOD. It's body changes -- transmutes -- Cable-like sinew snaking over grained limbs to approximate the more traditional bio- mechnoid alien appearance...! ANTHONY POV The weary android sees the Alien as a conglommoration of his many Medieval images of demons.  He hears the Alien's hollow, raspy breath.  It glides towards him... Anthony steps back directly INTO A TRAP as his mind goes -- SNAP!! The STEEL JAWS spring shut on his left ankle. Milky blood-fluid starts to flow. He finds himself in the same predicament as his vision -- Ankle pinned, the Alien's appendages circling him -- He screams.  AAAAAAAAAAAARGH --! AT THE DOOR Ripley is trying to work.  She punches numbers into the keyboard. She is too exhausted to see straight. They HEAR the scream -- John RUNS back -- Traps SNAPPING around him -- Ripley turns towards the sound -- The Abbot pushes her back to the keyboard -- ABBOT OPEN IT!! Ripley knits her brows.  Forces herself to focus. Her fingers punch the keys. THE ALIEN Steps towards Anthony -- Snap-snap-SNAP-AP-!! Traps snap closed on its tail, its legs -- HALFWAY DOWN THE HALL - JOHN SNAP!! His cassock is snagged in a trap. He TEARS right out of it -- AT THE END OF THE HALL Anthony is in the clutches of the Alien. He WHACKS at the Beast with his staff, but his blows fall like drops of rain on an elephant. The Alien LIFTS him up to face him.  Anthony SCREAMS as his left leg is stretched agsinst the tension of the trap's chain -- Blood pouring as white ribbons from his almost severed ankle. FACE TO FACE WITH THE ALIEN Anthony drops his staff and grabs each of the alien's arms with his own android arms.  His extra-human strength keeps them from squeezing him any tighter, but he cannot avert his gaze from the smooth, eyeless face. The Alien considers him.  Its thin, almost translucent lips pull back to reveal rows of splinter-like teeth.  The jaws spread, making room for the distended tongue: The Alien HISSES -- PUTS OUT Anthony's EYES with a thin stream of ACIDIC SALIVA -- Artificial skin BUBBLES AND BLISTERS -- JOHN Picks up Anthony's staff. Begins to FLAIL away at the demon. AT THE DOOR Ripley is getting no response from the keyboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong?! Ripley slides the keyboard out of the wall compartment. The wires are so old they've broken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. She BITES the ends off the wires - spits out the insulation. TWISTS the bare wire ends together... Sweat runs into her eyes. JOHN WHACKS the Alien with Anthony's staff -- Again.  Again.  The creature will not let Anthony go. The Android writhes in its grasp, his face now a blistered, pulpy mass, eyes gone. RIPLEY Finishes hot wiring.  The keyboard hums to life. Her fingers FLY across the keys -- THE ALIEN Tail wraps around John's waist -- Pulls him towards it -- LIFTS him - turns him upside down -- Lips PULL BACK -- John's hands GROPE at the floor -- Sharp metal teeth SPREAD -- THE DOOR KEYBOARD Lights:  CODE ACCEPTED Ripley's head whips towards the corridor -- JOHN His hand closes around the end of one of the traps -- He brings it up -- SNAP!! It SLAMS closed on the Alien's extended Tongue -! The Beast bellows!! Whips its head from side to side -- Can't shake off the trap -- ACID BLOOD sprays out --! Lands as pools of FIRE on the wooden floor. THE DOOR Opens with a strained blast of dust -- SEE-WHORCSSH! The Abbot LEAPS inside -- RIPLEY It's open!! JOHN PRIES Anthony's ankle out of his trap. Scoops up his staff, drags the moaning Android -- Back up the corridor -- RIPLEY Stands in open Technology Room doorway -- ABBOT Close it -- close it -- it's coming -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We wait.  John!! John and Anthony appear out of the shadows -- Run/hobble towards the door -- THE ALIEN Acid Blood DISSOLVES the traps' steel jaws.  PULLS itself free. Head whips towards the escaping Monks -- if it had eyes they would narrow to slits in anger -- RUNS up the hall -- RIPLEY Follows John and Anthony into the Technology Room. On the other side of the doorway: another keyboard. She punches keys -- ABBOT Hurry -- JOHN HURRY!! THE ALIEN Yards away -- Limping.  Hissing. ANGRY. THE KEYBOARD Acceptance tone "bings." The Door starts to slide down -- The Alien is feet away -- INCHES... The door seats itself closed with a solid THUD. Ripley, panting, rests eyes closed against the rough wooden door.  A beat. She turns to the room for the first time and finds -- WINDMILLS Real Man of LaMancha wood and cloth windmills.  Two story high arms slowly rotating.  Moving enormous volumes of air through the wind tunnel-like room.  As far as the eye can see. Turning, creaking. WHOOSH...WHOOSH... But no electronics.  No radio.  No weapons. This is the Technology Room. Ripley collapses to the floor and loses consciousness. DISSOLVE TO: INT. SULACO ESCAPE SHIP #4 (DREAM) Yellow warning lights PULSE.  Those goddamned STROBES are flickering on and off.  Steam blasts out overhead pipes. The blue-spark pilot light muzzles of a FLAME THROWER shyly pokes out from behind a console.  It's owner cautiously follows... RIPLEY She's breathing heavy. She's wearing a sweat soaked tank top. Her eyes flit from side to side.  Then up.  Then down. She pokes the weapon out ahead of her and moves into the pod. She silently crosses the distance to Newt's sleep tube: IN THE TUBE Newt sleeps peacefully. Ripley allows herself one maternal smile, then remembers. Her grip TIGHTENS in the Flame Thrower in her hands. She flips a switch to HI HEAT. Moves around the sleep tubes... A noise to her left. She WHIRLS -- Pulls the trigger on the flame thrower -- click.  Nothing. She tries again -- a half-hearted burp, but no flame. She begins to panic -- Senses the Alien's presence. Looks left, right, up - no Alien... Looks down: The Alien's tail is COMING UP BETWEEN HER LEGS. She turns -- Right into it's grasp. The useless flamethrower SKITTERS across the floor. She PUMMELS the beast with balled up fists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  NO!  I beat you!  I beat you mother fucker!! The Alien spins her -- pushes her over across the sleep tube -- Like it's taking her from behind! Ripley looks down into the sleep tube: Newt is gone. Her doll's head lays in a pool of blood. The Alien wraps his arms around Ripley. Thin lips pull back for a kiss. She SCREAMS. INT. TECHNOLOGY ROOM - REALITY - DAY Ripley opens her eyes. WHOOSH...WHOOSH... She's still in the room with the windmills. Somehow this place seems less real than her dream. She looks around: John is sitting next to her, writing on a piece of parchment. He smiles a relieved smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought we'd lost you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you writing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last will and testament. (beat) Just kidding. She looks to her left: Anthony is lying on his back, cotton bandage wrapped around his eyes.  His ankle is a swollen mess.  Wires are hanging out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he --?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Resting. (shakes his head) He'll be fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No I won't.  He's a terrible liar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's ironic.  I guess my visions were prescience after all.  How will I ever resolve that with my artifical con- science? A creaking floorboard to Ripley's right draws her attention to The Abbot.  He's pacing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you see what you've delivered us into?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  Lead me not into temptation to kick your -- ahh -- Ripley tries to stand - her head spins. WHOOSH...WHOOSH...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh shit. The entire room THROBS with the rhythm of the wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is the Big Boy -? The Abbot points to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the other side of that door. Waiting for us to starve to death. Ripley moves to the door and feels it's cold surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's playing with us.  It could get in here any time it wants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why should he enter?  He knows that one of the people in this room is in league with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir.  We're all in the same coracle, so to speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe more than one of us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's talk about the facts, Mr. Abbot. She looks at the windmills. WHOOSH...WHOOSH...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is your technology?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even this is forbidden to us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well then, the facts are that we're screwed. She moves into the room.  Walks around one of the Windmills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An Eco system.  Nothing to recycle your atmosphere except the green plants.  Winds generated down here -- (looks at the floor) Windmills use the natural surface winds to turn wheels underground, create tides on the seas to recirculate your water...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More than that.  There are pumps beneath the floor - I can feel their vibration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably pumping this air through charcoal filters. WHOOSH...WHOOSH...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It gets colder all the time here, right? John looks at her questioningly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your wood burning fires throw soot into the atmosphere, building the cloud layer - cutting off the sun's rays - cooling the planet, forcing you to burn more wood. WHOOSH...WHOOSH...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Greenhouse Effect.  It's how the Earth almost destroyed itself in the late 20th century.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you see?  This is a planet set to self destruct.  Not in ten minutes or two hours but soon.  Your atmosphere here is finite.  If the plants die the fires will eat up all the oxygen - this planetoid will be dead - Everyone will die. The Abbot has the look of a man who has been beaten in the last few meters of a Marathon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's here.  I was just hoping I would be dead long before it came to this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're supposed to die here.  That's the point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute -- you were exiled --?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The punishment for our crime was death. Anthony sits up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This planet is the supreme triumph of planned obsolesence.  A certain amount of primitive materials with an atmosphere processing system as fragile as a real environment but not replenishable. The Abbot has a faraway look in his eyes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poetic justice for the anti-technologists. The Company's best work.  You know, I used to be a corporate executive.  Middle range V.P.  Then my wife got hit by a speed craft. I chucked it all and joined the order. Be a monk -- see the world.  Being here, being chairman of the board...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, now I understand why I landed here. To join you happy lunatics in your deaths. Ripley moves away... John starts after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ripley, wait -- The Abbot stands, blocks his way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where can she go?  She's trapped. (beat) Trapped inside her own prison.  A prison in her mind.  Inside her mind.  Dancing. Sparklets of light - dance with the june bugs in the recesses of ourmindstheyare coming to danceintheshadowof... John and Ripley turn to look at the Abbot. He begins to speak faster.  Faster. He shakes.  Vibrates is more accurate -- A trickle of BLOOD runs from his left ear...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: RidingthewildwindsofchangeNoescapeNo escapeforthewickedEvilEvilthynameis woman.Woman.Womanheiscoming.Heiscoming foryouuuuuuuuu --* SPLORTCH-KT--!! The Abbot's HEAD EXPLODES --!!! Like a ripe melon dropped ten stories onto pavement. Blood, bone, hair and brain matter SPRAY John. John SCREAMS. A HORRIBLE ALIEN HEAD BURSTER Is all that sits atop the blood spurting neck of the Abbot. It keeps it's hold on the Abbot's spinal cord -- The Abbot's body continues to stagger around, arms jerking mechanically as lack of fresh nerve impulses from the brain works its way through the system. Ripley SCREAMS. The Infant Alien-headed corpse stumbles towards her -- She plucks Anthony's staff from the floor and SWINGS -- -- Like a child hitting a baseball from a TEE -- WHACK-K -!! BLASTS the Chest/head burster across the room -- It hits the floor SCRAMBLING.  Scuttles down into where the Windmills meet the floor.  Disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!  It came out of his fucking head!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't have to see that to know what that means.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sent him to us.  That bastard outside. I can't get away from him.  He's fucking with my mind.  He's my punishment!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm confused.  Before you said it came out of the torso, not the head -- RIPLEY I don't feel like a discussion of Alien biology. John comes up next to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ripley, don't -- She pushes him away and sinks to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should just wait for the air to run out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe - I know - that we can win -- there is an answer in our books.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your books?  Your books are gone, Brother. Your world is gone.  Once that thing starts to lay its eggs, all your brothers - if they aren't already - are dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If that's true, then all of us, the books, are consigned to ashes. He clasps his hands and bows his head. The Abbot's blood drips off his hands. Plip - plop! Into a little puddle at Ripley's feet. She stares at the blood.  Aahk. Feels the PAIN again. Runs her hand across her chest...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ripley?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are several inconsistancies between this and the other Aliens you described.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think this is important.  This may help us fight it.  The creature that I fought in the hall - when I first saw it, it had camoflaged itself to look like wood. Ripley looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wood?  When I saw it in my room it looked the way it did before -- black, mechanical -- unless that was a dream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think it was.  I think that this creature, if it is the efficient predator that you say it is, has the ability to adapt to its environment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then the reason they've always looked the same to me is that I only ever saw them in the same environment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or this may be an as yet unseen stage of development -- you saw a queen -- This could be like a King ant -- more highly advanced than the drone, bred for survival -?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How does this explain the thing that came out of the ewe's chest?  The Abbot's head?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it can deposit different types of eggs.  The chest burster is probably dormant until the host eats - The first one I ever saw came out of Kane after he started to eat -- And in one horrible moment she realizes: She hasn't eaten.  The pain in her chest...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Anthony "looks" towards her - does he realize as well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, we're not beat yet, Father -- JOHN Brother -- Ripley gets up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brother.  Not yet.  If he's taunting me, then maybe we can use that.  We can beat this bastard.  We can get to my ship. We can live.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. TECHNOLOGY ROOM John stands by a ladder that runs up to a trap door in the ceiling.  Holds a torch. Ripley is on the ground with Anthony, his injured leg splayed out in front of him.  Skin is palid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't have second thoughts.  Blind and crippled I would only slow you down. Give him time to figure out what you're doing.  Just leave me my staff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  Good luck. She shakes his hand.  He pulls her closer. Anthony's empty eye sockets seem to see as he looks at Ripley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ripley, I know.  Good luck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit tight. Ripley crosses to John.  Poised at the bottom of the ladder they look up at the trap door on the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He could be waiting on the other side of that door.  We might not get ten feet before he kills the three of us. He shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We had better go, then. He smiles. She smiles back. They move up the ladder. It leads up a damp, short shaft, walls GREEN with algae, to AN UNDERGROUND DOCK - NIGHT The ladder shaft opens onto a barnacled pier.  Ripley and John climb out onto the wooden structure.  Before them: AN UNDERGROUND SEA stretches the width of the entire planet, over five miles across.  The floor of the lowest level of the top half of the orbiter makes a ceiling that looms a hundred feet overhead. The water sparkles with a golden glow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must be day on the surface of the planet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is the light coming from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mirrors.  Reflect the outside light down great shafts -- through lenses.  That's what they make in the glass factory. Lenses.  Look -- She turns: A HUGE WATERFALL Lit from within by daylight beaming down from above -- pours into the sea a short distance from them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Opens to the surface.  Water flows in and out.  I don't know how.  There's one at either end.  I came down on the other side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we do? John points to three small leather and wood coracles bobbing at the end of their ropes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brother John Goldman of the orbiter Arceon, Minorite abbey and gaol, know the Abbot was wrong.  There is a great evil here.  I have seen it.  I put pen to paper now lest this plague - this creature stills my hand.  I have gone down below - both to try to warn the others and get the woman - Ripley - get from her some clue as to how to battle this evil, or at least to make my peace for not defending her.  She believes there is still and Earth and I hope she is right. I hope she will be able to find out. I hope she can find some rest for the devils that torment her. direction.raw_text: Whether the Earth exists or not, whether we end up in Heaven, or Hell, or the cold vacuum of space, she has. She sets her course. Gets back into her tube. Closes the lid.
